alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Neshoba; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 11 at 3:26PM CDT until May 11 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Jasper County in east central Mississippi... Newton County in east central Mississippi... Neshoba County in east central Mississippi... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 325 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Edinburg to near Steele to near Burns, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Pearl River and Conehatta around 335 PM CDT. Philadelphia and Prospect around 340 PM CDT. Decatur and Stratton around 345 PM CDT. Union, Stallo, Burnside and Neshoba around 350 PM CDT. Roberts, Little Rock and Lawrence around 355 PM CDT. Newton and Herbert Springs around 405 PM CDT. Hickory around 415 PM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and east central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
